intro: Gochnatia maisiana, commonly known as the Australian ironwood, is a member of the Asteraceae family and is native to Australia. It is a small, shrub-like plant characterized by its dense, woody structure and small, narrow leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in compact heads, which are typical of the daisy family. It is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a hardy species. Gochnatia maisiana is often used in landscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
